summary:
We hope you’ve been having a good summer (at least if you’re up here in the
northern hemisphere).  Today we’re back with a new release of the self-hosted
Snikket server software. 
This software is what’s at the core of the Snikket project - a self-hostable
“personal messaging server in a box”...
title: Snikket Server - September 2024 release

summary:
I have a concept of all my concepts. 
That’s right, I went there
Meet the first major release of Flipper Zero firmware — version 1. 0.  In this release, we have completed work on many features that have been in development for 3 years and are now stable...
title: Firmware 1.0 Released

summary:
Bookmarks Blitz.  (Day 3)
It occurred to me that someone might be interested in knowing that you can get a feed to these bookmarks posts without any other posts from this weblog.  All tags provide a feed, RSS/Atom/JSON, and I only apply the bookmarks tag to bookmarks posts...
title: Bookmarks Blitz! (Day 3)

summary: Microsoft Corp.  today released updates to fix at least 79 security vulnerabilities in its Windows operating systems and related software, including multiple flaws that are already showing up in active attacks.  Microsoft also corrected a critical bug that has caused some Windows 10 PCs to remain dangerously unpatched against actively exploited vulnerabilities for several months this year
title: Bug Left Some Windows PCs Dangerously Unpatched

summary: I just finished my first coffee table made of oak.  It looks nice, but it’s not just another oak table, this is my first one.  Moreover, this one has history involving unfinished shelves, broken corners, accidents and many more...
title: I made a coffee table!

summary: Last night, I wrote a joke on Mastodon that I thought was a funny roast of Cohost users in light of the website shutting down.  It was only funny to me, so I deleted it.  I understand that Cohost was of special interest to a very small and vulnerable group...
title: Cohost, A Cautionary Tale

summary: One of my technological indulgences is that I upgrade my phone yearly, and for the last several years this means I get whatever the newest iteration of the Pixel phone from Google is.  This year it’s the Pixel 9, and I opted to go with the “Pro” version.  It has slightly improved cameras plus a […]
title: First Impressions of the Pixel 9 Pro
